skill.name: axiom-audit
skill.description: Audit Axiom logs to identify and prioritize errors and warnings, research probable causes, and flag log smells. Use when user asks to check Axiom logs, analyze production errors, investigate log issues, or audit logging patterns.
skill.summary: Audit Axiom logs to identify and prioritize errors and warnings, research probable causes, and flag ...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: The skill requires read-only access to query Axiom logs and codebase. It uses environment variables for secure credential storage and has no file modification capabilities. The skill is designed for legitimate log auditing purposes with appropriate security measures.

content.user_title: Audit Axiom logs for errors and warnings
content.value_statement: Production errors hide in massive log volumes. This skill systematically audits Axiom logs to identify, prioritize, and research errors with root cause analysis.
actual_capabilities: Queries Axiom logs for errors and warnings using APL
Prioritizes issues by severity (P0-P4) and frequency
Researches root causes in the codebase
Identifies logging anti-patterns and log smells
Generates comprehensive audit reports with trends
limitations: Requires Axiom API credentials and external tools
Read-only access - cannot fix errors directly
Depends on proper log formatting and levels
Limited to Axiom log datasets only

use_cases.title: Production Error Investigation
use_cases.description: Quickly identify and prioritize critical errors in production logs during incidents

use_cases.title: Code Quality Analysis
use_cases.description: Find error patterns and logging issues to improve application reliability

use_cases.title: Logging Best Practices Audit
use_cases.description: Detect log smells and ensure proper logging standards across services

prompt_templates.title: Basic Error Audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Check for errors in the last 24 hours
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit my Axiom logs for errors in the last 24 hours. Generate a report showing the most frequent errors and their probable causes.

prompt_templates.title: Critical Issue Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all P0 critical errors in my logs from the past week. Research each error's root cause in the codebase and provide actionable fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Log Quality Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my logs for logging anti-patterns and smells. Check for excessive logging, missing context, sensitive data exposure, and inconsistent error levels.

prompt_templates.title: Trend Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare error trends from this week vs last week. Identify new errors, increasing patterns, and recently resolved issues.

best_practices: Set up Axiom credentials as environment variables before running audits
Review P0 and P1 errors first for immediate impact assessment
Use the generated reports to track error resolution progress
anti_patterns: Ignoring warning-level logs that might indicate future problems
Running audits without researching root causes in the codebase
Focusing only on error counts without considering severity levels

faq.question: What credentials do I need?
faq.answer: You need an Axiom API token (AXIOM_TOKEN) and optionally your organization ID (AXIOM_ORG_ID). Find these in your Axiom dashboard.

faq.question: How does priority scoring work?
faq.answer: Errors are scored P0-P4 based on severity (CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW) and frequency. Critical errors with high frequency are P0 priority.

faq.question: Can this fix my errors?
faq.answer: No, this is an audit tool only. It identifies and researches errors but cannot modify code. Use the reports to guide your fixes.

faq.question: What are log smells?
faq.answer: Log smells are anti-patterns like excessive logging, missing context, sensitive data exposure, or inconsistent error levels that make debugging harder.

faq.question: How do I install required tools?
faq.answer: Install axiom-mcp with 'go install github.com/axiomhq/axiom-mcp@latest' and mcptools following the instructions in SKILL.md.

faq.question: Can I audit multiple datasets?
faq.answer: Yes, use 'mcp call listDatasets' to see available datasets, then specify the dataset name in your APL queries.
